title: New: The Yum Dee Days – Everyone's Your Friend
body:
Back in 2013, Brooklyn outfit **The Yum Dee Days** appeared from nowhere with a cohesive collection of gritty, surf-tinged indie pop songs.

No backstory, no team around them, no expectations. As the year went on, it became a record that I constantly found myself revisiting, and as I did, I noticed tracks disappearing or being added to their Bandcamp page, only adding to the mystique of the situation. Now a couple of years on, and stepping out under their real names, Jay and Jim, the duo are ready to graduate from playing house parties and free-for-alls, to take the live circuit by storm. Their official ‘debut’ offering, Everyone’s Your Friend, is part **Strokes**, part **War on Drugs**. It’s the sort of life affirming, anthemic guitar pop that seems to be in short supply at this moment in time. Check it out below.

Follow our [Spotify On Repeat playlist](https://open.spotify.com/user/crackintheroad/playlist/1UB6gJIZpmiO0H2zmSbg02) for a hand-picked selection of the current hottest tracks.
